intro: Gymnaster lixianensis, commonly known as the Lixian gymnaster, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
